org.emoncms

Interface Emoncms


  • public interface Emoncms
    The Emoncms class is used to communicate with an emoncms webserver. The Energy monitoring Content Management System is an open-source web-app for processing, logging and visualising energy, temperature and other environmental data as part of the OpenEnergyMonitor project. An emoncms instance can be used to
    • Post data to inputs and logging feeds.
    • Retrieved stored or processed feed data values.
    • Configure data processing or other settings.
    • Get configuration information.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
    throws EmoncmsUnavailableException
        Start the content management systems' communication, such as the initiation of thread pools or verifications of configured parameters.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsUnavailableException - if the configured parameters cannot describe a communication

      • stop

        void stop()
        Shuts the content management systems' communication down and cleans up resources.

      • post

        void post(java.lang.String node,
          java.lang.String name,
          Timevalue timevalue,
          java.lang.String devicekey)
   throws EmoncmsException
        Post a Timevalue to a defined Input, identified by its node and name and authenticated by a device API key.

        If the timevalues timestamp equals null, the CMS will use the current timestamp, to further process the input. The HTTP post requests may be authenticated with a devicekey, enabling to write values to a defined devices' node ID. This can be useful, to avoid the storage of an API key with more permissions.

        Parameters:
        node - the Node ID of the input, a timevalue should be posted to.
        name - the Name of the input, a timevalue should be posted to.
        timevalue - the timevalue to post.
        devicekey - the device API Key, to authenticate the request.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • post

        void post(java.lang.String node,
          java.lang.String name,
          Timevalue timevalue)
   throws EmoncmsException
        Post a Timevalue to a defined Input, identified by its node and name.

        If the timevalues timestamp equals null, the CMS will use the current timestamp, to further process the input.

        Parameters:
        node - the Node ID of the input, a timevalue should be posted to.
        name - the Name of the input, a timevalue should be posted to.
        timevalue - the timevalue to post.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • post

        void post(java.lang.String node,
          java.lang.Long time,
          java.util.List<Namevalue> namevalues,
          java.lang.String devicekey)
   throws EmoncmsException
        Post a list of Namevalues to a defined Input, identified by their node and name and authenticated by a device API key.

        If the time equals null, the CMS will use the current timestamp, to further process the inputs.

        If the timevalues timestamp equals null, the CMS will use the current timestamp, to further process the input. The HTTP post requests may be authenticated with a devicekey, enabling to write values to a defined devices' node ID. This can be useful, to avoid the storage of an API key with more permissions.

        Parameters:
        node - the common Node ID of the inputs, a value should be posted to.
        time - the timestamp, the posted values should be processed with.
        namevalues - the list of namevalues that will be posted.
        devicekey - the device API Key, to authenticate the request.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • post

        void post(java.lang.String node,
          java.lang.Long time,
          java.util.List<Namevalue> namevalues)
   throws EmoncmsException
        Post a list of Namevalues to a defined Input, identified by their node.

        If the time equals null, the CMS will use the current timestamp, to further process the inputs.

        Parameters:
        node - the common Node ID of the inputs, a value should be posted to.
        time - the timestamp, the posted values should be processed with.
        namevalues - the list of namevalues that will be posted.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • post

        void post(DataList data)
   throws EmoncmsException
        Post data to a set of Inputs.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to post to the CMS.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • getInputList

        java.util.List<Input> getInputList(java.lang.String node)
                            throws EmoncmsException
        Returns the list of all Input objects of the authenticated user and the specified node ID. An input allows to configure processes and post data through e.g. Input.post(Timevalue).

        Inputs hold all their configuration fields in memory, but may be cleared to only hold their ID, node and name by calling Input.clear(). Input methods only need those variables to maintain their functionality and other resources may be released to save memory.

        Parameters:
        node - the Node ID, inputs should be returned for.
        Returns:
        the list of inputs.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • getInputList

        java.util.List<Input> getInputList()
                            throws EmoncmsException
        Returns the list of all Input objects of the authenticated user. An input allows to configure processes and post data through e.g. Input.post(Timevalue).

        Inputs hold all their configuration fields in memory, but may be cleared to only hold their ID, node and name by calling Input.clear(). Input methods only need those variables to maintain their functionality and other resources may be released to save memory.

        Returns:
        the list of inputs.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • getInput

        Input getInput(java.lang.String node,
               java.lang.String name)
        throws EmoncmsException
        Returns the Input object for the specified node and name. An input allows to configure processes and post data through e.g. Input.post(Timevalue).

        Inputs hold all their configuration fields in memory, but may be cleared to only hold their ID, node and name by calling Input.clear(). Input methods only need those variables to maintain their functionality and other resources may be released to save memory.

        Parameters:
        node - the Node ID of the input to get.
        name - the Name of the input to get.
        Returns:
        the input object.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • getInput

        Input getInput(int id)
        throws EmoncmsException
        Returns the Input object for the specified input ID. An input allows to configure processes and post data through e.g. Input.post(Timevalue).

        Inputs hold all their configuration fields in memory, but may be cleared to only hold their ID, node and name by calling Input.clear(). Input methods only need those variables to maintain their functionality and other resources may be released to save memory.

        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the input to get.
        Returns:
        the input object.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • getFeedList

        java.util.List<Feed> getFeedList()
                          throws EmoncmsException
        Returns the list of all Feed objects of the authenticated user. A feed allows to retrieve the latest data and configuration fields, as well as historical data through e.g. Feed.getData(long, long, int).

        Feeds hold all their configuration fields in memory, but may be cleared to only hold their ID, by calling Feed.clear(). Feed methods only need the ID to maintain their functionality and other resources may be released to save memory.

        Returns:
        the list of feeds.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • getFeed

        Feed getFeed(int id)
      throws EmoncmsException
        Returns the Feed object for the specified feed ID. A feed allows to retrieve the latest data and configuration fields, as well as historical data through e.g. Feed.getData(long, long, int).

        Feeds hold all their configuration fields in memory, but may be cleared to only hold their ID, by calling Feed.clear(). Feed methods only need the ID to maintain their functionality and other resources may be released to save memory.

        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the feed to get.
        Returns:
        the feed object.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • getFeedValues

        java.util.Map<Feed,java.lang.Double> getFeedValues(java.util.List<Feed> feeds)
                                            throws EmoncmsException
        Returns the latest values of a list of Feed objects.
        Parameters:
        feeds - the list of feeds to get the latest values for.
        Returns:
        a map of corresponding feed values.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • newFeed

        int newFeed(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String tag,
            Datatype type,
            Engine engine,
            Options options)
     throws EmoncmsException
        Creates a new Feed for the emoncms server. A feed allows to retrieve the latest data and configuration fields, as well as historical data through e.g. Feed.getData(long, long, int).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the feed to create.
        tag - an optional descriptor that will be used to group feeds in the emoncms web view. The tag may be left null.
        type - the Datatype of the feed.
        engine - the Engine of the feed.
        options - the options of the feed engine. Depending of the engine, this may be left null.
        Returns:
        the ID of the newly created feed.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.
